summary: The Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Institute is a federally funded, nonprofit corporation that funds and evaluates research aimed at improving health care decisions. Among other things, the Institute funds research to compare available treatment options for various diseases and conditions. The Institute—and Health and Human Services—are also required to share the findings of the research. The Institute met its goal of getting its research cited in...
title: Comparative Effectiveness Research: Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Institute and HHS Continue Activities and Plan New Efforts
